sinks.name: TEE_AllocateOperation
sinks.reason: Potential for improper allocation if algorithm type is tainted

sinks.name: TEE_AllocateOperation
sinks.reason: Potential for improper allocation if mode of operation is tainted

sinks.name: TEE_AllocateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Size or type parameters could be manipulated to cause improper allocation, leading to buffer overflows or memory corruption.

sinks.name: TEE_AsymmetricEncrypt
sinks.reason: Unencrypted output to Normal World could expose sensitive data if tainted plaintext is used.

sinks.name: TEE_AsymmetricEncrypt
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on the public key could lead to buffer overflows or memory corruption.

sinks.name: TEE_AsymmetricEncrypt
sinks.reason: Shared memory operations could allow tainted data to be manipulated and exposed to the Normal World.

sinks.name: TEE_GenerateKey
sinks.reason: Output buffer may be shared with Normal World, leading to exposure of sensitive keys.

sinks.name: TEE_GenerateKey
sinks.reason: Size parameter may be tainted, leading to buffer overflow or memory corruption issues.

sinks.name: TEE_SetOperationKey
sinks.reason: Potential for buffer overflow if the key size is manipulated and not properly validated.
